abstract.t: The current strongest authentication method for RIPv2 (RFC2453[6]) is the MD5 authentication (RFC2082[5]) which uses shared secret key to authenticate the packets. This memo explains the different security flaws we found in the anti-replay and the MACs calculation. The second part presents practical exploitations of these weaknesses: an attacker directly connected to a link, can (i) break neighborhood, (ii) flap routes and (iii) inject obsolete routes.
